overview_of_class: This course examines the links between illegal drugs and politics, from the politics of local communities to international public policy. The production, distribution, and consumption of illicit drugs affect politics in a myriad of ways by shaping individual behavior, local and national institutions, cultural practices, markets, and international relations. The aim of the course is to examine these linkstheoretically and empiricallywith a focus on North, Central, and South America. We will critically analyze public policy on "the drugs problem", especially the US-led "war on drugs".
name: Drugs and Politics
subject: POLI_SCI
